meanings.sent1: The party was so glamourless, with no decorations or music.
meanings.sent2: Her outfit was so glamourless that no one noticed her at the event.
meanings.sent3: The magician's attempt to add glamour to the show ended up making it even more glamourless.
meanings.sent4: The once vibrant city now appeared glamourless under the gray clouds.
meanings.sent5: The old, abandoned mansion stood glamourless against the backdrop of the modern skyline.

meanings.sent1: The plain, glamourless building failed to attract any visitors.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement for the product was so glamourless that no one wanted to buy it.
meanings.sent3: The cake, though delicious, looked glamourless with its lopsided frosting.
meanings.sent4: Her smile turned glamourless as she realized no one was listening to her story.
meanings.sent5: The once colorful garden now appeared glamourless after the flowers wilted.

meanings.sent1: The museum's glamourless exhibit failed to capture the attention of the visitors.
meanings.sent2: The book's cover was so glamourless that no one picked it up to read.
meanings.sent3: The party became glamourless when the music suddenly stopped playing.
meanings.sent4: His jokes fell flat, leaving the room feeling glamourless and awkward.
meanings.sent5: The once lively street now seemed glamourless in the dim evening light.
